summary: This bill, the USPS Services Enhancement and Regulatory Viability Expansion and Sustainability for the US Act (USPS SERVES US Act), aims to modernize the United States Postal Service (USPS). It focuses on cost and efficiency reforms, including changes to rate setting and regulations. The bill addresses sanctions for service failures, improves change-of-service procedures, and modifies rate increase frequency. It also establishes an Office of the Customer Advocate, improves the complaint process, and addresses reimbursement for unlawful rates. Additionally, it modifies provisions related to retiree health benefits fund investment.
